sub_topic: The self-similarity of the Koch island.
message_1: What is the perimeter of the Koch island after five iterations, given that the initial side length is 10 units?
message_2:
The Koch island is formed by applying the Koch curve to each side of an equilateral triangle. The Koch curve is a fractal that increases the length of a line segment by a factor of 4/3 at each iteration.

After five iterations, the length of each side of the Koch island will be:

Initial side length × (4/3)^5
10 × (4/3)^5 = 10 × (1024/243) ≈ 42.1227 units

Since the Koch island is an equilateral triangle, it has three equal sides. Therefore, the perimeter of the Koch island after five iterations is:

Perimeter = 3 × Length of one side
Perimeter ≈ 3 × 42.1227 ≈ 126.3681 units
